Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacterium:Micrococcus luteus;Gram-negative bacterium:Escherichia coli.Fungi:Neurospora crassa, Fusarium oxysporum.
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Posesses antibacterial and antifungal activity. Presents chitin-binding activity.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Higher expression in hemocytes and to a lesser extent in heart, testis, gills, intestine, lymphonoid organ and hepatopancreas. Traces in eyes and subcuticular epithelium. Not present in the brain.
Sequence Information.Developmental stage: Expression decreases 3 hours after microbial challenge to return to control levels after 12 hours and slightly increases after 24 hours.
Sequence Information.PTM: Contains three disulfide bonds 31-46; 35-53; 47-54, Pyrrolidone carboxylic acid and Lysine amide at position 1 and 62 respectively.

Literature.Title: Penaeidins, a family of antimicrobial peptides from penaeid shrimp (Crustacea, Decapoda).
Literature.Author: Destoumieux D, Munoz M, Bulet P, Bachère E.

Literature.Title: Penaeidins, antimicrobial peptides with chitin-binding activity, are produced and stored in shrimp granulocytes and released after microbial challenge.
Literature.Author: Destoumieux D, Muñoz M, Cosseau C, Rodriguez J, Bulet P, Comps M, Bachère E.

Literature.Title: Penaeidins, a new family of antimicrobial peptides isolated from the shrimp Penaeus vannamei (Decapoda).
Literature.Author: Rodriguez J.,van Dorsselaer A.,Loew D.,Bulet P.,Destoumieux D.
